findings.title: Use of a custom transfer fee causes the creation of SNS neurons to fail
findings.description: When a token swap is committed or aborted, the `Swap::finalize` method uses the default Internet Computer Protocol (ICP) transfer fee instead of the fee defined during the SNS network’s configuration, causing the creation of SNS neurons to fail.

findings.title: Failure to ensure that all neurons have been created before the transition to Normal mode
findings.description: The `Swap::set_sns_governance_to_normal_mode_if_all_neurons_claimed` method sets the SNS governance mode to `Normal`, but it fails to check whether `create_neuron.skipped` is also 0, which can lead to setting the mode to `Normal` even if some neurons have not been created successfully.

findings.title: Unnecessary calls to unwrap in get_root_status
findings.description: The function get_root_status unnecessarily unwraps the result and would thus avoid a panic if it simply returns an object of type `Option<CanisterStatusResultV2>`.

findings.title: Erroneous controller check in SnsRootCanister::set_dapp_controllers
findings.description: The set_dapp_controllers function in SnsRootCanister has an erroneous controller check.

findings.title: Accounts with low balances are trimmed from the ICRC-1 ledger
findings.description: The ICRC-1 ledger trims accounts with low balances based on a threshold calculated by adding `MAX_ACCOUNTS` and `ACCOUNTS_OVERFLOW_TRIM_QUANTITY` values.

findings.title: 6. Potentially harmful remove_­self_­as_­controller pattern
findings.description: The remove_­self_­as_­controller function has a potentially harmful pattern that could lead to security issues.

findings.title: Use of panicking functions poses a risk to the ledger’s archiving mechanism
findings.description: The ICRC-1 ledger calls the `archive_blocks` function to archive a prefix of the local blockchain, which creates an `ArchiveGuard` that contains a write lock on the global `Archive` instance of the ledger state.

findings.title: Insecure Representation of `None`
findings.description: The `Swap::sns_token_e8s` method uses 0 to represent `None`, which can lead to implementation errors and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Unchecked Token Amount Calculation
findings.description: The `Swap::cf_total_icp_e8s` method does not use saturating or checked addition to calculate token amounts, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: The `Swap::can_commit` method can be simplified
findings.description: The code in figure D.3 can be changed to the simpler code in figure D.4.
